data.text: @james_e_b_ So if kids wear mittens 7 hours per day it wouldnâ€™t impact their ability to function in any way?  Has this lady ever worn mittens?  They work for the brief period you need them but every kid has tossed them when the important outdoor work needs to happen in the winter playtime.
@james_e_b_ For an epidemiologist, she truly has some of the dumbest analogies.
@james_e_b_ Her next one will be even dumber

@james_e_b_ @EpiEllie go compare los angeles to dallas per capita for deaths/cases. It's substantial in difference...sorry you guys were fed a narrative that doesn't bear out though. gotta be tough. https://t.co/7bSZ1nPzoD
@james_e_b_ @EpiEllie And @EpiEllie if you really think kids' gross gappy masks protect them/others..I dunno. You're educated? Have eyes? https://t.co/dL3TsEDuSM
@james_e_b_ @EpiEllie Mittens don't block the place you communicate and smile from..DERP.  25% jump in mental health emergencies for kids 5 to 11 ..  https://t.co/1Ljfpyysis
@LourencoJML @james_e_b_ It takes so much self control not to respond to everything she writes.
@JayVee92366925 @james_e_b_ She started off perfectly reasonable. Then slowly went into the deep end.
@james_e_b_ @ZenobiaStorah I'm torn between @DrEricDing and @EpiEllie. Tough contest of sheer lunacy, severe misjudgement of data, and alienation from reality.
